clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of Metastasectomy in Patients With Oligo-Metastatic Breast Cancer(OMIT)
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of Metastasectomy in Patients With Oligo-Metastatic Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized clinical trial (OMIT study) evaluating the efficacy of metastasectomy in patients with oligo-metastatic breast cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Overall survival is calculated from randomization to death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization at baseline to the time of the first event, assessed up to 60 months
secondary_outcome.description: From date of randomization at baseline to the time of the first event (Disease progression, local recurrence or distant metastasis, contralateral breast cancer, second primary tumor, or death from any cause), whichever came first, assessed up to 60 months

arm_group.description: The metastatic sites are firstly treated by surgery then followed by systemic treatment
After confirmation of puncture, receive systemic treatment

intervention.description: patients randomized to this group will receive metastasectomy for the metastatic sites then followed by the systemic therapy
